i18n.description: A rock. It doesn't do much.

i18n.description: Cute and harmless.

i18n.description: It stings. Don't touch it.

i18n.description: It's got wings and it's ready to use them.

i18n.description: It's hungry and flowers are its favorite meal.

i18n.description: It's just there doing its thing.

i18n.description: Cute and harmless... if left unprovoked.

i18n.description: Shiny, cute and mostly harmless.
i18n.name: Ladybug

i18n.description: Spooky.

i18n.description: Not an advertisement.

i18n.description: His name is Patrick.
i18n.name: Starfish

i18n.description: Mr. Crab.
i18n.name: Crab

i18n.description: Makes the most delicious jam.
i18n.name: Jellyfish

i18n.description: Wrong game, bud.
i18n.name: Digger

i18n.description: Bob.
i18n.name: Sponge

i18n.description: Slurp slurp.
i18n.name: Leech

i18n.description: Slurp slurp.
i18n.name: Leech

i18n.description: Puffy.
i18n.name: Dandelion

i18n.description: This ant is on fireeeeeeeeeeeeee.
i18n.name: Baby Fire Ant

i18n.description: This ant is on fireeeeeeeeeeeeee.
i18n.name: Worker Fire Ant

i18n.description: This ant is on fireeeeeeeeeeeeee.
i18n.name: Queen Fire Ant

i18n.description: Not yet an ant but perhaps soon.
i18n.name: Ant Egg

i18n.description: This ant is not yet on fire.
i18n.name: Fire Ant Egg

i18n.description: Hzzzzzzzzzzzz.
i18n.name: Fly

i18n.description: It's not a leaf, but it is a bug.
i18n.name: Leafbug

i18n.description: You better pray you don't become dinner.
i18n.name: Mantis

i18n.description: Weak and defenseless, but big dreams.<n/>These creatures appear to be connected somehow.
i18n.name: Baby Termite

i18n.description: It's a bit temperamental, probably from working all the time.<n/>These creatures appear to be connected somehow.
i18n.name: Worker Termite

i18n.description: It's got wings and it's ready to use them.<n/>These creatures appear to be connected somehow.
i18n.name: Soldier Termite

i18n.description: The one who oversees all.
i18n.name: Termite Overmind

i18n.description: Termites go in, and come out. Can't explain that.
i18n.name: Termite Mound

i18n.description: Not yet a termite but perhaps soon.
i18n.name: Termite Egg

i18n.description: Don't misunderestimate me.
i18n.name: Bush

i18n.description: Gotta go FAST... until they get tired.
i18n.name: Roach

i18n.description: Easily scared, be nice.
i18n.name: Moth

i18n.description: Oooooh shiny.
i18n.name: Firefly

i18n.description: Scourge that spawns in the other plane.
i18n.name: Beetle

i18n.description: They are ANGRY.
i18n.name: Wasp

i18n.description: How do you have this in your gallery?
i18n.name: Target Dummy

i18n.description: Scourge that spawns in the other plane.
i18n.name: Spider

i18n.description: Scourge that spawns in the other plane.
i18n.name: Centipede

i18n.description: Scourge that spawns in the other plane.
i18n.name: Centipede

i18n.description: Scourge that spawns in the other plane.
i18n.name: Wasp

i18n.description: This can happen to YOU.
i18n.name: Gambler

i18n.description: There's something magical about this one.
i18n.name: Firefly

i18n.description: This one has a different pattern... what does that mean?
i18n.name: Beetle

i18n.description: It's supposed to eat dirt but this one's eating flowers.
i18n.name: Worm

i18n.description: You're not supposed to see this text. I'm calling the police.
i18n.name: Worm guts

i18n.description: A nice petal, not too strong but not too weak.
i18n.name: Basic

i18n.description: Weaker than most petals, but recharges very quickly.
i18n.name: Light

i18n.description: Extremely durable, but takes a bit longer to recharge.
i18n.name: Rock

i18n.description: This shape... it looks familiar...
i18n.name: Square

i18n.description: Its healing properties are amazing. Not so good at combat though.
i18n.name: Rose

i18n.description: It really hurts, but it's very fragile.
i18n.name: Stinger

i18n.description: Very poisonous, but takes a little while to do its work.
i18n.name: Iris

i18n.description: It comes and goes.
i18n.name: Wing

i18n.description: You can actually shoot this one.
i18n.name: Missile

i18n.description: It goes poof. Now with a secret ingredient: poison.
i18n.name: Grapes

i18n.description: Not very strong, but somehow increases your maximum health.
i18n.name: Cactus

i18n.description: It's so light it makes your other petals spin faster.
i18n.name: Faster

i18n.description: Physics are for the weak.
i18n.name: Bubble

i18n.description: Asthmatics beware.
i18n.name: Pollen

i18n.description: Its interesting properties inhibits healing effects on affected units.<n/>Affected units have their healing reduced by 20%. Stacks with itself.
i18n.name: Dandelion

i18n.description: Something interesting might pop out of this.
i18n.name: Egg

i18n.description: Allows your flower to sense foes farther away.
i18n.name: Antennae

i18n.description: This thing is so heavy that nothing gets in the way.<n/>Slows down petal rotation speed when equipped.
i18n.name: Heavy

i18n.description: This mysterious petal affects the rotation of your petals in unpredictable ways.
i18n.name: Yin Yang

i18n.description: It's really sticky.
i18n.name: Web

i18n.description: Mobs love this. Attracts them in a large radius.<n/>Mobs will prioritize this over flowers.<n/>Affected units develop immunity to its effects after some time.
i18n.name: Honey

i18n.description: Gathers energy from the sun to heal your flower passively.
i18n.name: Leaf

i18n.description: Reflects some of the damage you take back to the enemy that dealt it.<n/>Higher rarity mobs have higher resistance to damage reflection.
i18n.name: Salt

i18n.description: Spawns very quickly, but not very strong.
i18n.name: Rice

i18n.description: Takes a long time to spawn, but has a lot of health.
i18n.name: Corn

i18n.description: A bunch of sand particles.
i18n.name: Sand

i18n.description: Debilitates enemies temporarily, reducing their movement speed.
i18n.name: Pincer

i18n.description: Heals your flower but only while in the defensive position.
i18n.name: Yucca

i18n.description: Increases drop pick up range.
i18n.name: Magnet

i18n.description: A dried leaf from the Yggdrasil tree.<n/>Rumored to be able to bring the fallen back to life.
i18n.name: Yggdrasil

i18n.description: Increases health regen while below 75% health.
i18n.name: Starfish

i18n.description: Just drop it off somewhere and use your kinetic powers so you don't lose it.
i18n.name: Pearl

i18n.description: Strikes several nearby enemies.
i18n.name: Lightning

i18n.description: No one likes touching this.
i18n.name: Jelly

i18n.description: Deals extra damage if the victim is above 80% health.<n/>-50% damage vs other flowers.
i18n.name: Claw

i18n.description: Adds a temporary shield to yourself or allies.
i18n.name: Shell

i18n.description: A friend used to own this... now it's time for revenge.<n/>Increases body damage.
i18n.name: Cutter

i18n.description: A small amount of heal but fairly consistent.
i18n.name: Dahlia

i18n.description: Periodically releases radiation.<n/>-75% damage versus other flowers.<n/>Effect strength depends on distance to petal.
i18n.name: Uranium

i18n.description: Spreads damage taken by the flower over a period of time.<n/>If destroyed, deals remaining damage all at once.<n/>Does not delay <c val="#ce76db">Poison</c> damage.
i18n.name: Sponge

i18n.description: Increases health, but also increases flower size and decreases movement speed.
i18n.name: Soil

i18n.description: Heals based on damage dealt by this petal.
i18n.name: Fangs

i18n.description: Allows your flower to expand your petals further out.
i18n.name: Third Eye

i18n.description: It goes poof.
i18n.name: Peas

i18n.description: A mysterious stick that summons the forces of the wind.
i18n.name: Stick

i18n.description: Increases your luck.<n/>Luck is used by specific petals to change their stats.
i18n.name: Clover

i18n.description: Increases movement speed.<n/>Disabled if flower takes damage or if near a mob higher than a certain rarity.
i18n.name: Powder

i18n.description: It's literally nothing.
i18n.name: Air

i18n.description: Increases all healing received.
i18n.name: Basil

i18n.description: A sweet citrus fruit.
i18n.name: Orange

i18n.description: Something interesting might pop out of this.
i18n.name: Egg

i18n.description: Makes mobs less likely to want to attack you.
i18n.name: Poo

i18n.description: A strange relic. Significantly increases maximum health.<n/>Damage taken is spread among other wearers.
i18n.name: Relic

i18n.description: Absorbs poison damage taken by the flower.
i18n.name: Lotus

i18n.description: A shiny lightbulb. Draws aggro from mobs.
i18n.name: Bulb

i18n.description: Absorbs damage taken by the flower.
i18n.name: Cotton

i18n.description: Sturdy and reliable. Can be shot and bounces off walls.
i18n.name: Carrot

i18n.description: Sturdy.
i18n.name: Bone

i18n.description: Does 20x damage vs projectiles and petals.
i18n.name: Plank

i18n.description: Gets stronger over time.
i18n.name: Tomato

i18n.description: A dark mark that binds itself to a fallen soul.
i18n.name: Mark

i18n.description: Increases knockback received. Also absorbs lightning damage dealt to the flower.
i18n.name: Rubber

i18n.description: It really hurts, but it's very fragile.<n/>Deals some of the damage dealt back to the flower.
i18n.name: Stinger

i18n.description: Decreases armor of affected unit. Does not stack with itself.
i18n.name: Bur

i18n.description: Provides additional armor but only while in the defensive position.
i18n.name: Root

i18n.description: An ancient relic.<n/>When destroyed, will teleport the flower back to where it was destroyed.
i18n.name: Ankh

i18n.description: Has a 5% chance of dealing 35x damage.<n/>Chance increases by 4% per point in luck.
i18n.name: Dice

i18n.description: A necklace that allows the wearer to anticipate enemy attacks.
i18n.name: Talisman

i18n.description: Discharges electricity whenever the flower gets hit.
i18n.name: Battery

i18n.description: Converts a percentage of overheal into shields.
i18n.name: Amulet

i18n.description: This crappy thing might be able to find something interesting...
i18n.name: Compass

i18n.description: Reduces damage taken from collisions with mobs and flowers.
i18n.name: Disc

i18n.description: Becomes untargetable but unable to use petals for a limited time.
i18n.name: Shovel

i18n.description: The power of capitalism compels you!
i18n.name: Coin

i18n.description: ALL IN.
i18n.name: Chip

i18n.description: A playing card. Likely marked.
i18n.name: Card

i18n.description: This thing is so big your petals orbit it instead.<n/>Where did you find this anyway?
i18n.name: Moon

i18n.description: Deals extra <c val="#ce76db">Poison</c> damage based on the existing <c val="#ce76db">Poison</c> damage per second.
i18n.name: Privet

i18n.description: Phases through enemies.<n/>Cannot damage enemies more often than a certain interval.
i18n.name: Glass

i18n.description: Corrupts one's soul, turning them against their own kind.
i18n.name: Corruption

i18n.description: Creates mana.
i18n.name: Orb

i18n.description: It goes poof. Now with the extra secret ingredient: lightning.
i18n.name: Blueberries

i18n.description: Absorbs damage taken by the flower.
i18n.name: Cotton

i18n.description: It really hurts, but it's very fragile.
i18n.name: Stinger

i18n.description: Gathers mana from the environment passively.
i18n.name: Leaf

i18n.description: Increases maximum mana capacity.
i18n.name: Cactus

i18n.description: Consumes half the current mana and deals damage based on that value.
i18n.name: Magic Eye

i18n.description: You can actually shoot this one... with magic.
i18n.name: Missile

i18n.description: A mysterious stick that summons the forces of the wind... with magic.
i18n.name: Stick

i18n.description: Breaks apart on impact.<n/>Each piece has 50% of the stats of the predecessor.
i18n.name: Coral

i18n.description: Physics are for the magicless.
i18n.name: Bubble

i18n.description: Reduces one damage instance damage by 98%.
i18n.name: Nazar
